concepts.title: Food Spoilage Factors
concepts.content: Food materials can be spoiled by wrong handling, over-cooking, or improper storage in damp places. Qualitative wastage of food occurs due to wrong protection methods or excessive use of preservatives. Food is considered spoiled if there is a change in its color, odor, texture, or taste.
concepts.funFact: The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) was established under the Act of 2006 to ensure safe food for all!
concepts.textbookRef: Page 34: Factors responsible for food spoilage

concepts.title: Food Preservation Methods
concepts.content: Various methods prevent microbial growth: Freezing (slows reactions), Smoking (uses aluminum phosphide), Irradiation (uses ionizing radiation), and Pasteurization (heating and rapid cooling). Nitrogen gas is often used in air-tight packets to prevent fungus.
keyPoints: Louis Pasteur developed the pasteurization technique
Vinegar and Citric Acid are chemical preservatives
Irradiation plants are located at Lasalgaon and Navi Mumbai
